name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Today, on National Vietnam War Veterans Day, I joined veterans at the Vietnam Memorial in Augusta to pay tribute to those who selflessly served our state and our nation during the Vietnam War. I hope all Maine people will join me in honoring these brave men and women. 2/2  https://t.co/vTb3q4CHCJ

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: As the daughter and sister of Maine veterans, I know firsthand we can never fully repay them, but we can remember and honor their service and sacrifice. 1/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: It was great to celebrate some of those world-class people who contribute so much to our state's maple syrup sector at Goranson Farm in Dresden today. I hope that all Maine families were able to celebrate our maple syrup and our maple syrup producers this weekend. 2/2  https://t.co/LS10e8cZxn

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Maine Maple Sunday Weekend is an opportunity for us all to celebrate the world-class products – and people – that make Maine unique. Our iconic maple syrup industry supports hundreds of jobs, strengthens our economy, and sets us apart nationwide. 1/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: I am grateful that no one has been hurt and urge people in the area to follow the advice of local authorities to stay safe. We will continue to monitor the situation closely and assist emergency first responders, the company, its workers, and the community. 2/2

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: I have been briefed on the fire at the Penobscot McCrum potato processing facility in Belfast and have directed @MaineEMA to remain in close contact with local and county officials and to provide support as needed. 1/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: My thanks to Commissioner Camuso and our incredible MDIFW staff for their work to protect our state’s cherished wildlife. 3/3

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: MDIFW monitors the health of Maine’s black bear population by checking in on mother bears and their cubs during the winter. I’m happy to report that mother and cubs were all doing well. 2/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: A beautiful, crisp morning with @mefishwildlife Commissioner Judy Camuso and her staff as we snowshoed in to a black bear den in Ashland. 1/  https://t.co/w4zkhe1KRK

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Thank you to the students at Dyer Elementary School for such a warm welcome this morning! I loved having the chance to read to you as you celebrate Literacy Week. Maine has a bright future with all of you.  https://t.co/HSTXhBJX6u

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Congratulations to the @SMCCSeawolves men's and @CMMustangs women's basketball teams on winning national championships! These wins are the result of your hard work, dedication, and perseverance and you make us all proud.  https://t.co/vA9mRns08D

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: I hope the lessons my fellow panelists and I shared help the next generation of Maine leaders, men and women, to reach new heights. 3/3

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: I told the students that leadership isn’t confined to elected office, and that you can be a leader in your classroom, in your workplace, in your job. You can be a leader by listening to other people. 2/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Yesterday, to commemorate International Women’s Day, I joined students at Eastern Maine Community College  to reflect on what it means to be a woman in leadership. 1/  https://t.co/VGsWqQzTyc

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Learn more about my proposal here:  https://t.co/sXWdZa1dOg 4/4

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Given that, and knowing that Maine people are grappling with inflation, I will propose giving back at least half of this additional revenue to the taxpayers, consistent with my current proposal and consistent with the calls of Republicans, to support Maine people. 3/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: In fact, Maine’s nonpartisan Revenue Forecasting Committee is expected to upgrade our State’s General Fund revenue forecast by about $411.6 million for the current biennium. However, economists are also warning us that revenues are volatile and should not be counted on. 2/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: The State of Maine continues to be in the black as a result of strong Federal support and the good fiscal management of my Administration and the Legislature. 1/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: My Administration will remain in touch with Federal agencies, Maine’s Congressional Delegation, and others as we continue to monitor developments and gauge any potential impacts on Maine people. 3/3

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: I support the Biden Administration’s aggressive sanctions to punish Russia, and I pray for the innocent men, women, and children of Ukraine who only want to live their lives peacefully and free from the dictates of Vladimir Putin. 2/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Maine stands in solidarity with the people of Ukraine in the face of this abhorrent, unprovoked assault on their country, their freedom, and their lives. 1/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Recent warmer weather should not make us underestimate this winter storm. I encourage all Maine people to be careful during their morning commute tomorrow, giving plenty of space to road crews as they work to clear the roads.

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: We will continue to deploy funds through my Jobs and Recovery Plan to expand child care across Maine, and I hope the Legislature will approve my budget proposal to continue increasing pay for our child care workers. 3/3

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Today I visited @UMF1864 which is using $1 million from my Jobs and Recovery Plan to renovate a former call center into a child care and early education center. I am proud that my Jobs & Recovery Plan is creating more child care for parents in Maine, but we have to do more. 2/  https://t.co/wiWFywq4TR

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: We know that a lack of quality affordable child care prevents people from taking jobs, from starting new businesses, from moving to rural communities, and it deprives kids of important developmental care. That’s why we are tackling this issue head on. 1/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: To learn more about my State of the State Address:  https://t.co/8Zav6qgnx6 30/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Tonight, we recommit to progress, to recovery, to moving forward towards normalcy. That is my mission, and I ask you all to join me. Because progress is why Maine people sent us here, and after these past 23 months, I have never believed more in the people of our great state. 29/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Look, it has been a turbulent year. But our state is beautiful. Our state is strong, and it is growing stronger. 28/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: We will make progress on the opioid epidemic, on improving the child welfare system, on combatting climate change, on bringing down the cost of electricity and energy, and on addressing the devastating impact of PFAS on our health and livelihoods. We will make progress. 27/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Maine people deserve every ounce of hard-won progress that we have achieved despite the pandemic. More than this, Maine people have earned the progress that is yet to come. 26/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Tonight, I am announcing that I will convene a Silver Cabinet to address long-term care issues and ensure that every person in Maine may age safely, affordably, in a way that best serves their needs. Maine people work hard their entire lives, and they deserve no less. 25/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: I have to say I thank God every day that we expanded Medicaid on Day One of my Administration, extending health care to 90,000 people. But that cannot be the end of our efforts. It is far past time to ensure that Maine people can live with dignity as they age.  24/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: No other Administration in Maine history has invested as much as we have in our hospitals, nursing homes, and other health care providers. 23/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Some of those people may be health care workers. To bolster the healthcare workforce, we have invested more than $600 million in health care providers. And tonight I propose that we send another $50 million to our hospitals and nursing homes across the State. 22/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: With these changes, the Opportunity Maine Tax Credit will be the leading student debt relief program in the nation and a powerful tool for employers to draw people from all walks of life to work and live in the State of Maine.  21/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: But what about those who have already graduated and have student debt? Tonight I am announcing that I will fund an overhaul of the Opportunity Maine Tax Credit so that those who graduated with student loan debt will be eligible for up to $25,000 total of debt relief. 20/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Second, for those young people whose aspirations have been most impacted by the pandemic, I propose making two years of community college free. There are so many good-paying jobs that are just waiting for you and the future is yours - we will help you embrace it. 19/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: We have so much to offer for education here in Maine. It is also our responsibility to ensure that these opportunities are affordable. I’ve got some ideas to tackle that too. First, I am proposing funding to stave off tuition hikes across the University of Maine System. 18/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: For the first time in Maine history we have met our commitment to fund 55 percent of the cost of education. To continue delivering on our promise, I propose creating an Education Stabilization Fund capitalized with $30 million from the General Fund. 17/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Reliable child care, affordable housing, high speed internet – all of these things are key to people being able to enter and stay in the workforce and provide for their families. But we also need to do more. 16/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Another thing keeping too many people from working, especially in rural areas of Maine, is the lack of affordable broadband. I pledge to you tonight that every person in Maine who wants to connect to high-speed internet will be able to do so by 2024 – just two years from now. 15/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: The lack of affordable housing is also a serious barrier to entering the workforce. We must make home ownership and affordable rentals reachable for more Maine people. To do that, we will invest $50 million to increase the number of energy-efficient, affordable homes. 14/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: We know that a lack of quality affordable child care prevents people from taking jobs, from starting new businesses, from moving to rural communities. My supplemental budget will include more than $12 million to increase pay for child care workers. 13/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Maine people are telling us that to stay at work they need child care, that they need housing, and that they need broadband, that they need good health care, and strong public schools for their kids. I agree. 12/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: As we continue to rebuild our economy, we know our workforce shortage is the largest impediment to sustained growth. It is a problem I inherited, but it is not one that I will leave to our grandchildren to solve.  11/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Many of my friends on the other side of the aisle have called for a return of half the surplus to Maine people through direct checks to help them with rising costs. I think they’re right. I propose that we send $411 million back to the people of Maine.

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: While I cannot control the impact of COVID-19 on global markets, I can make sure that we deliver to Maine people the resources they need to grapple with these rising costs as we rebuild a stronger economy that is more resilient to the whims of the rest of the world. 9/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: All of this is progress. At the same time, Maine is not immune from the impact of pandemic-driven inflation, from higher energy prices caused by an over-reliance on fossil fuels and supply chain issues that contribute to higher prices at the grocery store. 8/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Our Rainy Day Fund has more than doubled under my Administration to nearly $500 million – the highest it has ever been. After passing strong, balanced budgets we are reporting a record budget surplus of $822 million. And we have achieved all of this without raising any taxes. 7/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Maine’s economy, like that of the rest of the nation, is making a comeback. Maine’s Gross Domestic Product – a key measure of economic growth – has not only fully bounced back from the pandemic, it has surpassed pre-pandemic projections. 6/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: You are why Maine is one of the most highly vaccinated states in the nation and why, despite being one of the oldest states, we have one of the lowest COVID death rates. Our goal has been to save lives and we have succeeded better than nearly every other state. 5/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: You can do your part by getting vaccinated. More than one million Maine people have done so, and to each of you, I am deeply grateful. 4/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: As the pandemic endures, my pledge to you is this: we will make vaccines and tests accessible to all; keep our children safe in their schools; ensure our health care systems can care for all; and keep our businesses not only open but thriving and our economy moving forward. 3/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Yes, we are tired; yes, we are weary, but we are strong. If nothing else, the two years of this pandemic have shown us that we are stronger than we ever imagined. 2/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Our presence in the State House tonight is a sign of progress, of recovery — a step forward in our march towards normalcy and stability, especially from where we have been. 1/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Tonight, I will deliver my State of the State Address at 7:00 p.m. I look forward to paying tribute to Maine people, to discussing our shared challenges, and to charting our path to a better tomorrow. You can watch live at @MainePublic  https://t.co/Y0KWEtf3nv

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: And as always please be sure to check in on your neighbors and loved ones to make sure they are okay. 4/4

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: That means staying off the roads if possible. Heavy snowfall and strong winds will create dangerous driving conditions. If you do have to drive, please do so cautiously and be sure to give plenty of room to road crews and first responders working to keep us all safe. 3/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: As the storm takes hold in Maine, I urge Maine people, especially those along the coast, to exercise good judgment and to be safe and cautious. 2/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: @MaineEMA continues to track the storm with the @NWSGray and @NWSCaribou and coordinate response efforts with @MaineDOT1 and our utilities. 1/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: To make testing available to more folks, today I announced that Maine is working with the @RockefellerFdn to mail 125,000 free rapid tests to Maine people most in need. To see if you are eligible to receive five free at-home rapid tests, visit  https://t.co/LxpjXWgbc6. 2/2

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Having convenient access to affordable, fast testing is an important tool to limit the spread of COVID-19 and to protect the health of Maine people as we go about our daily lives. 1/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: With a serious storm expected tomorrow, I encourage people to be cautious and careful and to avoid driving if at all possible. If you do have to be on the road, it's always important to be mindful of road crews and emergency responders who are working to keep us all safe.

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: We will continue to work to encourage entrepreneurs to start new businesses, to train new workers, and to create what Maine people need, like housing and childcare and internet, to fill good-paying jobs in every corner of our state. 3/3

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Our state’s progress this past year, despite the pandemic, would not have been possible without the innovation and ingenuity of Maine people, including our small business owners. 2/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: This week I joined business leaders at the @BangorChamber and the @MidMaineChamber to discuss our state’s response to the coronavirus pandemic and our economic recovery.  1/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: I urge the Legislature to support this bill so I can accompany my daughters and my granddaughters to the polls to cast my vote so that they will have the equal opportunity under the law that we have come to expect and demand.  https://t.co/hsFacYlgPI

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: You can visit @MaineEMA's website to find a warming center near you:  https://t.co/egg7sVtHjb. Please be safe and stay warm.

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: For those who are concerned about their ability to stay warm, support is available by calling 2-1-1, with warming centers now opening in communities across the state. 2/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: With extreme cold temperatures, I encourage Maine people to take every precaution to stay warm and to check on friends, family and neighbors to ensure they are safe. 1/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: I urge all Maine people to get vaccinated so you can stay out of the hospital, protect our youngest citizens, and make sure all Maine people get medical care, regardless of whether it’s related to COVID. 5/5

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: I hope Maine people join me in saying thank you to our health care workers, but the best way to thank them – the best way to relieve the burden on their shoulders – is to heed their advice: get vaccinated. 4/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Whether you provide health care at a hospital, at a doctor’s office, in a nursing or assisted living facility, at a vaccination site, in someone’s home, or in the back of an ambulance, please know, that Maine is grateful to you.  3/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: During this difficult time, I want them to know how thankful we are for all they are doing. Today, on my tour of @MaineMed, I spoke with and thanked hospital staff for their tireless efforts to save the lives of Maine people during the pandemic. 2/  https://t.co/KWJXKHg8py

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Health care workers are the heart of our response to COVID-19. They’ve been on the frontlines for nearly two years saving the lives of Maine people, all while enduring risks to their own health and the added pressure and stress of the job. 1/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: My Administration will continue to work with the Legislature to address property taxes, increase the availability of housing, and ensure that all Maine people, regardless of age or income, are able to have a safe, stable place to call home in our state. 4/4

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: To see if you qualify for these property tax loans, which must be repaid once your property is sold or becomes part of an estate, and to apply, visit the Maine Bureau of Revenue Services website here:  https://t.co/Bkmdhg4cVM 3/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Today, my Administration launched a program to provide lifeline loans to eligible Maine people who are ages 65 and older or who are permanently disabled and who cannot afford to pay their property taxes on their own. 2/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Older Mainers and those with disabilities deserve to live and age in the comfort of their homes without worrying they’ll lose them because they can’t afford the property taxes. 1/  https://t.co/lRlHbmc1rZ

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: I am proud to support this endeavor and thank GMRI and the Poole family for their responsible stewardship. 4/4

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Preserving and protecting Maine’s working waterfronts will ensure the strength and vitality of our maritime industry for years to come, will keep Maine people working in our waters and waterfronts, and will keep delivering Maine’s world-class seafood across the globe. 3/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Union Wharf is not only historic, it’s a part of our heritage. Thanks to the Poole family and GMRI, it will always be a part of our future now. 2/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: I was pleased to join @GMRI @CityPortland & the Poole family today to celebrate the purchase of Union Wharf, a cornerstone of Portland’s working waterfront that powers our economy and that supports marine businesses & the livelihoods of our fishermen, processors & dealers. 1/  https://t.co/Q1G0DcduPP

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Maine people knew that expanding health care was not only the right thing to do for our people, but it was also the right thing to do for our economy. My Administration will continue to fight for more accessible and affordable health care. 3/3

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: As a result of Medicaid expansion, nearly 90,000 people across Maine are able to see a doctor, receive preventive care, afford medications, and take care of themselves when they become sick, all of which are incredibly important as we continue to tackle the pandemic. 2/

name: Governor Janet Mills
tweet: Three years ago today – my first day in office – I signed an Executive Order expanding voter-approved Medicaid in Maine. 1/  https://t.co/fOX4okwEM3
